alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 8:19PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Collier, Mainland Monroe, western Miami-Dade and southwestern Broward Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 819 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley to near Dade-Collier Training Airport to 9 miles west of Mahogany Hammock. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Loop Road Ee Center, Dade- Collier Training Airport, Shark Valley Obs Tower, Mahogany Hammock, Pa-Hay- Okee Overlook, Wilderness Waterway, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Everglades National Park, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Fortymile Bend, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Big Cypress National Preserve and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
